ALLEGATION: Three residents digitally penetrated each other while in the
back seat of an agency van on a field trip in July 2019.
INVESTIGATION:
Children’s Village, New Beginnings program, is a non-secure program. Staff to student
ratio is 1:8. All residents involved in allegation were placed in the facility by courts.
Resident C was removed from the facility on 3/2/20.
I reviewed the following documents:
 Staff to Student Resident Ratio and Supervision of Residents policy
 Vehicle sign out sheet (Month of July 2019)
2

Staff to Student Resident Ratio and Supervision of Residents policy:
Youth Specialists will keep their assigned residents within their Line of Sight at all
times. This means a Youth Specialist will be able to see and notice all movement
and be aware of the whereabouts of their assigned residents at all times during
their shift…
Vehicle sign out sheet:
 July field trip dated on 7/25/19 to Auburn Hills playground.
I interviewed Resident A. Resident A reported the staff drove the residents to a
playground in July using a van. The van had four or five rows. Resident A reported
Resident B, Resident C and herself were in the last row. Resident A reported there was
more than six residents in the van, but unsure of the total number. Resident A reported
there was one staff driving and Staff 1 sitting in the first row of the van. Resident A
reported both staff could not see what they were doing. Resident A reported she
digitally penetrated Resident B and Resident C vaginas. Resident A reported they all
showed each other their pubic hair as well. Resident A reported, Staff 1, Youth Care
Specialist, did ask what they were doing because they were laughing loudly. Resident A
reported the staff were unaware of what they did.
I interviewed Resident B. Resident B reported the staff drove the residents to a
playground. The staff drove a van with five rows. Resident B reported there were
around eight residents in the van. Resident B reported Resident A and Resident C and
herself were in the last row. Resident B reported one staff was driving the van and the
other staff, Staff 1, was sitting in the first row. Resident B reported neither staff could
see what they were doing. Resident B reported Resident A and Resident C were
digitally penetrating each other’s vagina’s. Resident B reported Resident A touched her
inner thigh and she told her to stop Resident A stopped. Resident B reported Staff 1
asked what they were doing because they were laughing loudly. Both staff were
unaware of what Resident A and Resident C were doing.
Both residents reported Staff 1 by name. The other staff was not consistent.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
3

ANALYSIS: The agency has a 1:8 ratio. There were two staff supervising the
residents. The agency had enough staff assigned to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: Staff did not have proper Line of Sight as outlined in agency
policy
 …This means a Youth Specialist will be able to see and
notice all movement…
Staff were not able to see and notice all movement.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
